page.title: 16 CRAFTS IN STUBHAMPTON AREA
page.content: Hurdle making is one of the main crafts,now drastically reduced today as sheep are no longer folded.Hurdles are made from Hazel coppice cut every 8-10 years,which being long grained is easily split and twisted.Hurdles are sold for fencing to garden centres. Hazle wood is also used for pea sticking,bean sticks and spars for thatching. Strings for bows are made using original spinner and machinery. The strings are in demand throughout the year and are made of Dacron or Kevlam,the latter being stronger will not stretch. There is a cabinet maker who acquires old unwanted furniture and uses it to reproduce period pieces of chippendale and also restore antique furniture. Restoration of china and glass and Gesso work is also carried out.
